results.title: Confessions of a Simple Surgeon
results.creator_credit: Educational Division of N S W Dept of TAFE and Paul Harmon
results.brief_description: This humorous presents the associated health risks of smoking and passive smoking in an often graphic but factual manner. “Confessions” calls for a total ban on tobacco promotion and its message to viewers is clear. If you smoke, quit. If you don’t , don’t be conned into smoking and avoid being a victim of passive smoking. It is presented by Dr Arthur Chesterfield-Evans, whose experience in surgery on cancer victims led him to become an activist in BUGAUP (Billboard Utilising Graffitists Against Unhealthy Promotions) and in the legal activities of the Non-Smokers Movement of Australia.

results.title: Conduction in P and N crystals
results.brief_description: Part two of the Semiconductor Physics series demonstrates how an extra free electron is introduced into a germanium crystal. One of the atoms having four valency electrons is replaced by a foreign atom having five valency electrons, such as an atom of antimony.

results.title: Conducting good music
results.creator_credit: David W. Ridgway, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Milan Herzog
results.brief_description: A brief outline of the history of conducting leads to a discussion of conducting as a sign language, which translates the composer’s signs and instructions on the score into signals which the orchestra can follow. How each conductor gives their own interpretation to a work is shown by contrasting performances of the same passage conducted by different artists. Features the Vienna Symphony Orchestra.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David W. Ridgway, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Milan Herzog

results.title: Conducting a meeting
results.creator_credit: Centron Productions and Young America Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speech”.
A group of adults, all talking at once, are involved in a discussion. Suddenly a voice calls the group to order and advises them on the correct way to hold a meeting. Parliamentary rules of procedure and the order of business are demonstrated from the first call to order to the final adjournment. Review of important features of meeting at end.

results.title: Condom sense
results.creator_credit: Jim Locker, Cerberus Productions and Steve Faigenbaum
results.brief_description: A very original, informative film aimed at encouraging men to take a more active role in contraception. Using comedy to dispel the myths and complaints associated with condom use, the film presents accurate information about birth control and opens up the issues of communication and responsibility in relationships.

results.title: Conditioning the young athlete (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Introduces the coach to the basic principles involved in training young athletes for competition. A training program should put together the appropriate combination of energy and muscle fitness according to the requirements of the sport.

results.title: Conditioned reflexes
results.creator_credit: Moscow Popular Science Film Studio, Brandon Films and Artkino Pictures
results.brief_description: Reviews some of the work of the Russian physiologist, Ivan Pavlov, whose experiments with conditioned reflexes paved the way to a better understanding of human and animal behaviour. The difference between blind instinct present in all animals from birth, and reflex reactions set up by conditioning to certain often repeated stimuli is made clear. The process of checking the reflexes is explained and its application in the treatment of certain neuroses in human beings is shown.
